channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY

item.title: Report I-2024040015
item.description:
Report I-2024040015

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: JOHN F KENNEDY AIRPORT
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/20/2024, during cruise phase of flight DL182 (JFK-FCO), a passenger identified a vape pen in a lavatory trash bin that was smoking. The flight attendant retrieved the vape pen from the trash bin and noted that the device was still smoking/"hissing". The flight attendant met with the captain, and they elected to remove the battery and place the vape pen into a containment bag. The captain then returned to the flight deck and contacted dispatch. A decision was made to continue to FCO as the vape pen had stopped smoking. No Flight Attendant or customer injuries were reported. The NRC and FAA were notified.
